datafield.subfield: Somewhere a band is playing -- Leviathan '99

Presents two novellas, including "Somewhere a Band Is Playing," in which a young writer discovers that all is not as it seems in a nostalgic community, and "Leviathan '99," in which Ishmael Hunnicut Jones prepares for a first interstellar hunt.

The veldt -- Let's play poison -- Fever dream -- Zero hour -- The Foghorn -- A sound of thunder -- The wind --The scythe -- Marionettes Inc. -- The other foot -- The pedestrian -- The trolley -- The smile -- The gift -- The last night of the world
The last night of the world
The illustrated man -- The veldt -- The foghorn -- The smile -- There will come soft rains -- The pedestrian.

SUMMARY: Presents dramatized highlights adapted for radio from the novel of the same title by Ray Bradbury.
Copy no. 1, in slipcase, acquired as part of an archival set from the publisher in 2008. Laid in: announcement and reproduction of no. 480 (Nov. 1974) of Monthly letter of Limited Editions Club.
by Ray Bradbury ; with an introduction by Martin Gardner and illustrations by Joseph Mugnaini.
LC has copyright deposit copy, with embossed stamp below colophon: This is one of 15 presentation copies 'out of series.'
Limited ed. of 2,000, designed by Ernst Reichl, and signed by author and illustrator.

written and adapted for the stage by Ray Bradbury with Tobias Andersen.
